Detailed Description

Smoothing frames: Gauss, Median, and Mean filter.

Function Documentation

double cvl_smooth_gauss_k_to_sigma (  int  k  ) 
 

Parameters:
k The parameter k of cvl_frame_smooth_gauss()
Returns:
Sigma.
Computes a sigma value that matches the given k: roughly 95% of the mass should lie within the mask.

int cvl_smooth_gauss_sigma_to_k (  double  sigma  ) 
 

Parameters:
sigma The parameter sigma of cvl_frame_smooth_gauss()
Returns:
k.
Computes a k value that matches the given sigma: roughly 95% of the mass should lie within the mask.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_smooth_gauss (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  k_h,
int  k_v,
double  sigma_h,
double  sigma_v
) 
 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
k_h Mask size in horizontal direction.
k_v Mask size in vertical direction.
sigma_h Sigma value in horizontal direction.
sigma_v Sigma value in vertical direction.
Returns:
The smoothed frame.
The number of matrix columns will be 2k_h+1, the number of rows will be 2k_v+1. All pixel types are supported. See also cvl_smooth_gauss_k_to_sigma() and cvl_smooth_gauss_sigma_to_k().

k_h Mask size in horizontal direction.
k_v Mask size in vertical direction.
Returns:
The smoothed frame.
The number of matrix columns will be 2k_h+1, the number of rows will be 2k_v+1. All pixel types are supported.

The smoothed frame.
The number of matrix columns will be 2k_h+1, the number of rows will be 2k_v+1. All pixel types are supported.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_smooth3d_gauss (  const cvl_frame_t *  frames[],
int  k_h,
int  k_v,
int  k_t,
double  sigma_h,
double  sigma_v,
double  sigma_t
) 
 

Parameters:
frames The frames.
k_h Mask size in horizontal direction.
k_v Mask size in vertical direction.
k_t Mask size in temporal direction.
sigma_h Sigma value in horizontal direction.
sigma_v Sigma value in vertical direction.
sigma_t Sigma value in temporal direction.
Returns:
The smoothed frame.
See cvl_convolve3d_separable() for a description of frames. The kernel size will be (2k_t+1)x(2k_v+1)x(2k_h+1). See also cvl_smooth_gauss_k_to_sigma() and cvl_smooth_gauss_sigma_to_k().
